seriesJson.title: Conversations on public relations
seriesJson.description: A series of informal half-hour discussions on the nature and ethics of public relations. Series is hosted by Philip Lesly, editor of the Public Relations Handbook.

node.title: Trends and problems in P.R.
node.description: This program features Milton Fairman of the Borden Company; and Howard Hudson, editor of The Quarterly Review of Public Relations.

node.title: Public relations and the public interest
node.description: This program features Eugene Miller, vice president, McGraw-Hill Publishing; and Professor Raymond Simon, Syracuse University.

node.title: Functions of public relations
node.description: This program features Glen Perry of DuPont Corporation, and L.L.L. Golden, columnist, Saturday Review.

node.title: Why and what is public relations?
node.description: This program features William Howlett, president of Consolidated Foods; and Professor Scott Cutlip of University of Wisconsin.
